Summary: round object with many bright multicolored lights flashing
divs: Sighting Details At 10:30 Indianapolis Time, we go outside and look to the east. the only star bright enough to find really easy is the star I'm talking about. ( if it is a star) At 10:30 it's about 20 degrees off the horizon just to the right of the Big Dipper handle. When it first comes up it's east to west in line with the Big Dipper. But, as time goes on it moves in a southwesterly direction NOT WEST LIKE EVERYTHING ELSE. There are a thousand stars out there tonight and not one looks like this one. It flashes red, white, blue, green, yellow at a fast pace and through the telescope looks like a round black background. Does anyone have a clue as to what it is? It's been there every night for several weeks now.
trends: There have been 126 other sightings in Indianapolis
There was one other sighting in Indianapolis on or around March 16th 2010
